      • isOP1LessThanOrEqualOP2

        public boolean isOP1LessThanOrEqualOP2(Operator op1,
                                       Operator op2)
        This method compares two operator objects and returns a true boolean if the first passed operator has a precedence value less than the second, or equal to the second
        Parameters:
        op1 - the first operator to be compared
        op2 - the second operator to be compared against
        Returns:
        boolean true if operator 1 precedence is less than or equal to operator 2, otherwise return false

      • isOP1LessThanOP2

        public boolean isOP1LessThanOP2(Operator op1,
                                Operator op2)
        This method compares two operator objects and returns a true boolean if the first passed operator has a precedence value less than the second
        Parameters:
        op1 - the first operator to be compared
        op2 - the second operator to be compared against
        Returns:
        boolean true if operator 1 precedence is less than operator 2, otherwise return false

      • isANumber

        public boolean isANumber(java.lang.String str)
        This method will return a boolean of true; if the string parameter is that of a number, otherwise it will return false
        Parameters:
        str - a single string that is to be checked if it is a number
        Returns:
        true boolean if the string passed is a number

      • convertInfixToRPN

        public java.lang.String convertInfixToRPN(java.lang.String infixNotation)
        This method will receive a calculation; that is held in a string and is written in infix form, then convert the infix form into an RPN postfix form and return that in a string. The method utilises the "shunting-yard algorithm", written by Edsger Dijkstra
        Parameters:
        infixNotation - the string to be passed into the method that contains a calculation; written in infix notation
        Returns:
        a string that is the same calculation as the passed in calculation; written in postfix notation (RPN)
